revision.comment: ShappeAli moved page [[Draft:Koyya Hassan Manik]] to [[Koyya Hassan Manik]]
revision.text:
'''Hassan Manik''' is a Maldivian film actor.
==Career== Mohamed Hilmy and Ali Waheed's direction, ''[[Ihsaas]]'' was released in 1993 in which Manik starred as a guardian to an orphan boy who is being psychologically disturbed following a [[false arrest]]. Afterwards, he played the role of a dedicated brother who discovers the immoral relationship of his niece with one of her teachers, in [[Amjad Ibrahim]]'s debut direction ''[[Huras]]'' (1996).<ref>{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/3058 |title=Amjey is unlucky when it comes to awards |work=Raajje.mv |language=Divehi |last=Abdulla |first=Azlifa |date=7 January 2017 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/a0Sc2 |deadurl=no |archivedate=15 November 2018 |accessdate=15 November 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was developed solely with the intention of winning [[Gaumee Film Awards]] though it failed to garner any award at 2nd Gaumee Film Awards ceremony.<ref name=Huras>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10626 |title=Amjey shocked with his deserving award |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 December 2016 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/C31be |deadurl=no |archivedate=22 December 2018 |accessdate=22 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2000, Manik featured alongside [[Ahmed Asim]], Mariyam Nazima and [[Waleedha Waleed]] in Haajara Abdul Kareem-directed ''[[Ajaaib]]'' which marks the first film in which Manik plays the lead role. The film depicts the relationship of two exemplary wives and their respective families regardless of societal norms.<ref name=Ajaaib>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |title=Top 10 Actors in Maldives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219100014/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref> He then played a supporting role in a film directed by Ali Waheed, ''[[Kulunu]]'' starring Ismail Wajeeh and Aishath Shirani, in which Manik was featured as an adviser to a conflicted father who arranges the marriage of his only daughter to an already committed man.The same year, he starred opposite [[Hussain Sobah]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]] and [[Mariyam Nisha]] in [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s debut direction ''[[Fahuneyvaa]]'' (2000) which portrays the love-conflict of a man between a prominent stage performer and a deaf-mute poor girl.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=4426 is a masterpiece by Nahula |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=21 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330060956/https://avas.mv/24396 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In the film, he played the role of Zubair Ali, father of a second wife who discovers her husband's secret marriage.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24768 |title=Nahula at her peak; aiming for 50 shows |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=1 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/12p50 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was critically appreciated by critics and was a commercial success.<ref name=Fahuneyvaa>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Mohamed Shavin]] and Ibrahim Giyas in [[Amjad Ibrahim]]-directed ''[[Aaah (film)|Aaah]]'' (2001) which revolves around two siblings involved in family business and the downfall of the younger brother's love life when he discovers his fiance is already married to an abusive husband.<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> This was followed by [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s drama film ''[[Naaummeedhu]]'' (2001) which depicts the story of a happily married couple whose life is shattered into pieces when they unintentionally invite a seductive woman into their life.<ref name=NahulaGaumeeInaam>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2009 - Fathimath Nahula |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/cai8A |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film receiving favorable reviews from critics emerged as the highest grossing Maldivian film of the year.<ref name=Zuleykha>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Manik collaborated with Easa Shareef for the horror film ''[[Ginihila]]'' (2003) alongside [[Ali Seezan]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Mariyam Nisha]] and [[Reeko Moosa Manik]], playing the role of Ibrahim Rafeeu, father of a mentally unstable young girl who commits suicide when her boyfriend rebuked her demand to leave his wife for her.<ref name=ginihila/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=Easa Shareef returns with a Lhen Foiy |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Ifraz |first=Ali |date=18 January 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181203125554/https://avas.mv/43170 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a young couple who decided to spend a romantic break to save their crumbling marriage and how events take a sinister turn when the wife experiences supernatural incidents which has her husband involvement in it.<ref name=ginihila>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/entertainment/32682?ref=mhr-home |title=Wish these actors will return |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=15 March 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/zZ6kn |deadurl=no |archivedate=12 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film is an unofficial remake of [[Vikram Bhatt]]'s [[Bollywood|Indian]] [[horror film]] ''[[Raaz (2002 film)|Raaz]]'' (2002) featuring [[Bipasha Basu]], [[Dino Morea]], [[Malini Sharma]] and [[Ashutosh Rana]] which itself is an unofficial adaptation of ''[[What Lies Beneath]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bollywood plays the aping game|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|work=[[Times of India]]|accessdate=27 April 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050417232830/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|archivedate=17 April 2005}}</ref>
Manik received critical acclaim for his "authentic" performance as a pervert in [[Abdul Faththaah]]'s critically praised romantic film ''[[Vehey Vaarey Therein]]'' (2005).<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Featuring [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Khadheeja Ibrahim Didi]], [[Mohamed Shavin]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]] in pivotal roles, the film narrates the story of unrequited love, and proved to be one of the highest-grossing Maldivian films of the year. [[Moomin Fuad]] and [[Ali Shifau]]'s critically appreciated crime film ''[[Heylaa (film)|Heylaa]]'' (2006) featured Manik in a small role as a concerned citizen.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/44005 |title=Fuad regrets his involvement in Happy Birthday |language=Divehi |work=Dho? |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 October 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/0U4IL |deadurl=no |archivedate=17 January 2019 |accessdate=17 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a fourteen years old ambitious boy who finds himself unknowingly being involved in smuggling of a revolver.<ref name=DRE11years/> It was the first Maldivian film to be shot in high-definition digital video.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=1343 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2018 - Ali Shifau |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/8kp79 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Though the film received positive reviews from critics, it was a commercial failure.<ref name=DRE11years>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/23701 |title=11 years anniversary for DRE; what did they achieve? |language=dv|work=Dho |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 September 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/3d8z7 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name=Moomin>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/107034 |title=Moomin not satisfied even after 12 Awards |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 July 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181216101531/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/DZ2eg |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Co-director of the film Shifau opined that its commercial status was a result of casting "not very prominent" faces in the film and the "film-goers were not ready to accept the genre" at the time of release.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.sun.mv/109020 |title=Chippe with new hopes after receiving National Award |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=8 August 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/aLZ95 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> His next release, [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]], [[Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=Top10Actresses>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2009, Manik starred alongside [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]] as supportive father-in-law of a secure first wife in Seezan's melodrama ''[[Karuna Vee Beyvafa]]'' (2009).<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa/> The film follows a downfall of a happily married couple on realizing the wife's infertility and destruction of their relationship with the invasion of a second wife.<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}}</ref> Manik's first release of 2010 was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed family drama ''[[Maafeh Neiy]],'' another collaboration with Seezan and [[Niuma Mohamed]].<ref name="MaafehNei">{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |title=Posters of Maafeh Nei is heavily criticised |language=dv |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100219063844/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film highlights many social issues including [[human rights]] abuses, [[forced marriage]]s and [[domestic violence]].<ref name="MaafehNei" /> He played the role of Naseer, a wealthy businessman who abuses his wife.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> The film received mixed reviews from critics, majority of them dismissing its melodrama and was a moderate success at box office.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> The last release of year featured Manik in the drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010) which was directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and starring opposite Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Fathimath Fareela]].<ref name="Heyonuvaane">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is victimised of domestic abuse.<ref name="Heyonuvaane" /> Even though the film majorly received negative reviews from critics, it emerged as a Mega-Hit and second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name="HeyonuvaaneDVD">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="HeyonuvaaneReview">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |deadurl=yes |archivedate=26 September 2018 |accessdate=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he worked with Hamid Ali for his ''[[Laelaa]]'' (2011) starring [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Amira Ismail]], [[Ahmed Easa]] and Hamid Ali.<ref name="Laelaa">{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |title="Laela": Why is a good screenplay needed? |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111011190147/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-11 |accessdate=5 October 2018 |df= }}</ref> The film revolves around two daughters who were forced to arranged marriages by their parent.<ref name="Laelaa" /> The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics and was declared a flop at box office.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |title=Laela's premiere: A big satisfaction for Hamid |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002195434/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-02 |accessdate=11 October 2018 |df= }}</ref>
In 2015, Manik was seen in [[Ravee Farooq]]-directed film ''[[Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey]]'' (2015) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]] and [[Mohamed Manik]]. The film follows a mother who is ready to do anything in her power to protect her child from any harm of adversity from a man who becomes afflicted with "Post Traumatic Amnesia".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/en/24524 |title=Ticket sales kick-off for "Mikoe Bappa Bae Bae" |publisher=Vaguthu |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=9 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vnews.mv/48730 |title=Dhivehi movie ''Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey'' released |publisher=''vnews'' |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=13 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |title=Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey: Ravi-Mahdi showed difference again |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Saeed, Asiyath Mohamed |language=Divehi|date=13 August 2015 |accessdate=8 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150816010157/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |archivedate=16 August 2015 }}</ref> It was one of the three entries from Maldives to the SAARC Film Festival 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |title=Three entries to SAARC Film Festival; No award |language=Divehi|publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Ahmed, Jaishan |date=9 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160615140918/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |archivedate=15 June 2016 |accessdate=15 June 2016}}</ref>

{{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Manik, Koyya Hassan}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Mal√©]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actors]] [[Category:Maldivian film actors]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

'''Hassan Manik''' is a Maldivian film actor.
==Career== Mohamed Hilmy and Ali Waheed's direction, ''[[Ihsaas]]'' was released in 1993 in which Manik starred as a guardian to an orphan boy who is being psychologically disturbed following a [[false arrest]]. Afterwards, he played the role of a dedicated brother who discovers the immoral relationship of his niece with one of her teachers, in [[Amjad Ibrahim]]'s debut direction ''[[Huras]]'' (1996).<ref>{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/3058 |title=Amjey is unlucky when it comes to awards |work=Raajje.mv |language=Divehi |last=Abdulla |first=Azlifa |date=7 January 2017 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/a0Sc2 |deadurl=no |archivedate=15 November 2018 |accessdate=15 November 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was developed solely with the intention of winning [[Gaumee Film Awards]] though it failed to garner any award at 2nd Gaumee Film Awards ceremony.<ref name=Huras>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10626 |title=Amjey shocked with his deserving award |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 December 2016 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/C31be |deadurl=no |archivedate=22 December 2018 |accessdate=22 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2000, Manik featured alongside [[Ahmed Asim]], Mariyam Nazima and [[Waleedha Waleed]] in Haajara Abdul Kareem-directed ''[[Ajaaib]]'' which marks the first film in which Manik plays the lead role. The film depicts the relationship of two exemplary wives and their respective families regardless of societal norms.<ref name=Ajaaib>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |title=Top 10 Actors in Maldives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219100014/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref> He then played a supporting role in a film directed by Ali Waheed, ''[[Kulunu]]'' starring Ismail Wajeeh and Aishath Shirani, in which Manik was featured as an adviser to a conflicted father who arranges the marriage of his only daughter to an already committed man.The same year, he starred opposite [[Hussain Sobah]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]] and [[Mariyam Nisha]] in [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s debut direction ''[[Fahuneyvaa]]'' (2000) which portrays the love-conflict of a man between a prominent stage performer and a deaf-mute poor girl.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=4426 is a masterpiece by Nahula |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=21 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330060956/https://avas.mv/24396 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In the film, he played the role of Zubair Ali, father of a second wife who discovers her husband's secret marriage.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24768 |title=Nahula at her peak; aiming for 50 shows |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=1 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/12p50 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was critically appreciated by critics and was a commercial success.<ref name=Fahuneyvaa>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Mohamed Shavin]] and Ibrahim Giyas in [[Amjad Ibrahim]]-directed ''[[Aaah (film)|Aaah]]'' (2001) which revolves around two siblings involved in family business and the downfall of the younger brother's love life when he discovers his fiance is already married to an abusive husband.<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> This was followed by [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s drama film ''[[Naaummeedhu]]'' (2001) which depicts the story of a happily married couple whose life is shattered into pieces when they unintentionally invite a seductive woman into their life.<ref name=NahulaGaumeeInaam>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2009 - Fathimath Nahula |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/cai8A |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film receiving favorable reviews from critics emerged as the highest grossing Maldivian film of the year.<ref name=Zuleykha>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Manik collaborated with Easa Shareef for the horror film ''[[Ginihila]]'' (2003) alongside [[Ali Seezan]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Mariyam Nisha]] and [[Reeko Moosa Manik]], playing the role of Ibrahim Rafeeu, father of a mentally unstable young girl who commits suicide when her boyfriend rebuked her demand to leave his wife for her.<ref name=ginihila/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=Easa Shareef returns with a Lhen Foiy |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Ifraz |first=Ali |date=18 January 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181203125554/https://avas.mv/43170 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a young couple who decided to spend a romantic break to save their crumbling marriage and how events take a sinister turn when the wife experiences supernatural incidents which has her husband involvement in it.<ref name=ginihila>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/entertainment/32682?ref=mhr-home |title=Wish these actors will return |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=15 March 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/zZ6kn |deadurl=no |archivedate=12 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film is an unofficial remake of [[Vikram Bhatt]]'s [[Bollywood|Indian]] [[horror film]] ''[[Raaz (2002 film)|Raaz]]'' (2002) featuring [[Bipasha Basu]], [[Dino Morea]], [[Malini Sharma]] and [[Ashutosh Rana]] which itself is an unofficial adaptation of ''[[What Lies Beneath]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bollywood plays the aping game|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|work=[[Times of India]]|accessdate=27 April 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050417232830/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|archivedate=17 April 2005}}</ref>
Manik received critical acclaim for his "authentic" performance as a pervert in [[Abdul Faththaah]]'s critically praised romantic film ''[[Vehey Vaarey Therein]]'' (2005).<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Featuring [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Khadheeja Ibrahim Didi]], [[Mohamed Shavin]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]] in pivotal roles, the film narrates the story of unrequited love, and proved to be one of the highest-grossing Maldivian films of the year. [[Moomin Fuad]] and [[Ali Shifau]]'s critically appreciated crime film ''[[Heylaa (film)|Heylaa]]'' (2006) featured Manik in a small role as a concerned citizen.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/44005 |title=Fuad regrets his involvement in Happy Birthday |language=Divehi |work=Dho? |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 October 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/0U4IL |deadurl=no |archivedate=17 January 2019 |accessdate=17 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a fourteen years old ambitious boy who finds himself unknowingly being involved in smuggling of a revolver.<ref name=DRE11years/> It was the first Maldivian film to be shot in high-definition digital video.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=1343 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2018 - Ali Shifau |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/8kp79 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Though the film received positive reviews from critics, it was a commercial failure.<ref name=DRE11years>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/23701 |title=11 years anniversary for DRE; what did they achieve? |language=dv|work=Dho |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 September 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/3d8z7 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name=Moomin>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/107034 |title=Moomin not satisfied even after 12 Awards |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 July 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181216101531/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/DZ2eg |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Co-director of the film Shifau opined that its commercial status was a result of casting "not very prominent" faces in the film and the "film-goers were not ready to accept the genre" at the time of release.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.sun.mv/109020 |title=Chippe with new hopes after receiving National Award |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=8 August 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/aLZ95 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> His next release, [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]], [[Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=Top10Actresses>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2009, Manik starred alongside [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]] as supportive father-in-law of a secure first wife in Seezan's melodrama ''[[Karuna Vee Beyvafa]]'' (2009).<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa/> The film follows a downfall of a happily married couple on realizing the wife's infertility and destruction of their relationship with the invasion of a second wife.<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}}</ref> Manik's first release of 2010 was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed family drama ''[[Maafeh Neiy]],'' another collaboration with Seezan and [[Niuma Mohamed]].<ref name="MaafehNei">{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |title=Posters of Maafeh Nei is heavily criticised |language=dv |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100219063844/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film highlights many social issues including [[human rights]] abuses, [[forced marriage]]s and [[domestic violence]].<ref name="MaafehNei" /> He played the role of Naseer, a wealthy businessman who abuses his wife.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> The film received mixed reviews from critics, majority of them dismissing its melodrama and was a moderate success at box office.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> Later in 2010, Manik appeared in a small role in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s ''[[Veeraana]]'' which deals with [[child sexual abuse]].<ref name=veeraana>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=97210 |title=Veeraana did a satisfactory business at box office |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=10 June 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100619204728/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=listcategory&cat=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-06-19 |accessdate=10 June 2010 |df= }}</ref> The film received mixed to positive reviews from critics; praising the writer and director for touching a condemnatory topic though criticing its "over-the-top melodrama".<ref name=veeraana/> Having a strong buzz prior its release, the film was proved to be a commercial success.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=96207 |title=Prior its release, seven shows of Veeraan booked housefull |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 May 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100516111848/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=listcategory&cat=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-05-16 |accessdate=13 May 2010 |df= }}</ref> The last release of year featured Manik in the drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010) which was directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and starring opposite Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Fathimath Fareela]].<ref name="Heyonuvaane">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is victimised of domestic abuse.<ref name="Heyonuvaane" /> Even though the film majorly received negative reviews from critics, it emerged as a Mega-Hit and second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name="HeyonuvaaneDVD">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="HeyonuvaaneReview">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |deadurl=yes |archivedate=26 September 2018 |accessdate=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he worked with Hamid Ali for his ''[[Laelaa]]'' (2011) starring [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Amira Ismail]], [[Ahmed Easa]] and Hamid Ali.<ref name="Laelaa">{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |title="Laela": Why is a good screenplay needed? |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111011190147/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-11 |accessdate=5 October 2018 |df= }}</ref> The film revolves around two daughters who were forced to arranged marriages by their parent.<ref name="Laelaa" /> The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics and was declared a flop at box office.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |title=Laela's premiere: A big satisfaction for Hamid |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002195434/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-02 |accessdate=11 October 2018 |df= }}</ref>
In 2015, Manik was seen in [[Ravee Farooq]]-directed film ''[[Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey]]'' (2015) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]] and [[Mohamed Manik]]. The film follows a mother who is ready to do anything in her power to protect her child from any harm of adversity from a man who becomes afflicted with "Post Traumatic Amnesia".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/en/24524 |title=Ticket sales kick-off for "Mikoe Bappa Bae Bae" |publisher=Vaguthu |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=9 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vnews.mv/48730 |title=Dhivehi movie ''Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey'' released |publisher=''vnews'' |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=13 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |title=Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey: Ravi-Mahdi showed difference again |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Saeed, Asiyath Mohamed |language=Divehi|date=13 August 2015 |accessdate=8 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150816010157/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |archivedate=16 August 2015 }}</ref> It was one of the three entries from Maldives to the SAARC Film Festival 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |title=Three entries to SAARC Film Festival; No award |language=Divehi|publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Ahmed, Jaishan |date=9 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160615140918/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |archivedate=15 June 2016 |accessdate=15 June 2016}}</ref>

{{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Manik, Koyya Hassan}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Mal√©]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actors]] [[Category:Maldivian film actors]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

'''Hassan Manik''' is a Maldivian film actor.
==Career== Mohamed Hilmy and Ali Waheed's direction, ''[[Ihsaas]]'' was released in 1993 in which Manik starred as a guardian to an orphan boy who is being psychologically disturbed following a [[false arrest]]. Afterwards, he played the role of a dedicated brother who discovers the immoral relationship of his niece with one of her teachers, in [[Amjad Ibrahim]]'s debut direction ''[[Huras]]'' (1996).<ref>{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/3058 |title=Amjey is unlucky when it comes to awards |work=Raajje.mv |language=Divehi |last=Abdulla |first=Azlifa |date=7 January 2017 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/a0Sc2 |deadurl=no |archivedate=15 November 2018 |accessdate=15 November 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was developed solely with the intention of winning [[Gaumee Film Awards]] though it failed to garner any award at 2nd Gaumee Film Awards ceremony.<ref name=Huras>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10626 |title=Amjey shocked with his deserving award |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 December 2016 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/C31be |deadurl=no |archivedate=22 December 2018 |accessdate=22 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2000, Manik featured alongside [[Ahmed Asim]], Mariyam Nazima and [[Waleedha Waleed]] in Haajara Abdul Kareem-directed ''[[Ajaaib]]'' which marks the first film in which Manik plays the lead role. The film depicts the relationship of two exemplary wives and their respective families regardless of societal norms.<ref name=Ajaaib>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |title=Top 10 Actors in Maldives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219100014/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref> He then played a supporting role in a film directed by Ali Waheed, ''[[Kulunu]]'' starring Ismail Wajeeh and Aishath Shirani, in which Manik was featured as an adviser to a conflicted father who arranges the marriage of his only daughter to an already committed man.The same year, he starred opposite [[Hussain Sobah]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]] and [[Mariyam Nisha]] in [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s debut direction ''[[Fahuneyvaa]]'' (2000) which portrays the love-conflict of a man between a prominent stage performer and a deaf-mute poor girl.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=4426 is a masterpiece by Nahula |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=21 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330060956/https://avas.mv/24396 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In the film, he played the role of Zubair Ali, father of a second wife who discovers her husband's secret marriage.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24768 |title=Nahula at her peak; aiming for 50 shows |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=1 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/12p50 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was critically appreciated by critics and was a commercial success.<ref name=Fahuneyvaa>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Mohamed Shavin]] and Ibrahim Giyas in [[Amjad Ibrahim]]-directed ''[[Aaah (film)|Aaah]]'' (2001) which revolves around two siblings involved in family business and the downfall of the younger brother's love life when he discovers his fiance is already married to an abusive husband.<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> This was followed by [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s drama film ''[[Naaummeedhu]]'' (2001) which depicts the story of a happily married couple whose life is shattered into pieces when they unintentionally invite a seductive woman into their life.<ref name=NahulaGaumeeInaam>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2009 - Fathimath Nahula |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/cai8A |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film receiving favorable reviews from critics emerged as the highest grossing Maldivian film of the year.<ref name=Zuleykha>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Manik collaborated with Easa Shareef for the horror film ''[[Ginihila]]'' (2003) alongside [[Ali Seezan]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Mariyam Nisha]] and [[Reeko Moosa Manik]], playing the role of Ibrahim Rafeeu, father of a mentally unstable young girl who commits suicide when her boyfriend rebuked her demand to leave his wife for her.<ref name=ginihila/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=Easa Shareef returns with a Lhen Foiy |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Ifraz |first=Ali |date=18 January 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181203125554/https://avas.mv/43170 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a young couple who decided to spend a romantic break to save their crumbling marriage and how events take a sinister turn when the wife experiences supernatural incidents which has her husband involvement in it.<ref name=ginihila>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/entertainment/32682?ref=mhr-home |title=Wish these actors will return |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=15 March 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/zZ6kn |deadurl=no |archivedate=12 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film is an unofficial remake of [[Vikram Bhatt]]'s [[Bollywood|Indian]] [[horror film]] ''[[Raaz (2002 film)|Raaz]]'' (2002) featuring [[Bipasha Basu]], [[Dino Morea]], [[Malini Sharma]] and [[Ashutosh Rana]] which itself is an unofficial adaptation of ''[[What Lies Beneath]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bollywood plays the aping game|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|work=[[Times of India]]|accessdate=27 April 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050417232830/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|archivedate=17 April 2005}}</ref>
Manik received critical acclaim for his "authentic" performance as a pervert in [[Abdul Faththaah]]'s critically praised romantic film ''[[Vehey Vaarey Therein]]'' (2005).<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Featuring [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Khadheeja Ibrahim Didi]], [[Mohamed Shavin]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]] in pivotal roles, the film narrates the story of unrequited love, and proved to be one of the highest-grossing Maldivian films of the year. [[Moomin Fuad]] and [[Ali Shifau]]'s critically appreciated crime film ''[[Heylaa (film)|Heylaa]]'' (2006) featured Manik in a small role as a concerned citizen.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/44005 |title=Fuad regrets his involvement in Happy Birthday |language=Divehi |work=Dho? |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 October 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/0U4IL |deadurl=no |archivedate=17 January 2019 |accessdate=17 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a fourteen years old ambitious boy who finds himself unknowingly being involved in smuggling of a revolver.<ref name=DRE11years/> It was the first Maldivian film to be shot in high-definition digital video.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=1343 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2018 - Ali Shifau |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/8kp79 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Though the film received positive reviews from critics, it was a commercial failure.<ref name=DRE11years>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/23701 |title=11 years anniversary for DRE; what did they achieve? |language=dv|work=Dho |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 September 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/3d8z7 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name=Moomin>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/107034 |title=Moomin not satisfied even after 12 Awards |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 July 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181216101531/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/DZ2eg |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Co-director of the film Shifau opined that its commercial status was a result of casting "not very prominent" faces in the film and the "film-goers were not ready to accept the genre" at the time of release.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.sun.mv/109020 |title=Chippe with new hopes after receiving National Award |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=8 August 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/aLZ95 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> His next release, [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]], [[Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=Top10Actresses>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2009, Manik starred alongside [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]] as supportive father-in-law of a secure first wife in Seezan's melodrama ''[[Karuna Vee Beyvafa]]'' (2009).<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa/> The film follows a downfall of a happily married couple on realizing the wife's infertility and destruction of their relationship with the invasion of a second wife.<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}}</ref> Manik's first release of 2010 was [[Ali Seezan]]-directed family drama ''[[Maafeh Neiy]],'' another collaboration with Seezan and [[Niuma Mohamed]].<ref name="MaafehNei">{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |title=Posters of Maafeh Nei is heavily criticised |language=dv |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100219063844/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film highlights many social issues including [[human rights]] abuses, [[forced marriage]]s and [[domestic violence]].<ref name="MaafehNei" /> He played the role of Naseer, a wealthy businessman who abuses his wife.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> The film received mixed reviews from critics, majority of them dismissing its melodrama and was a moderate success at box office.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> Later in 2010, Manik appeared in a small role in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s ''[[Veeraana]]'' which deals with [[child sexual abuse]].<ref name=veeraana>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=97210 |title=Veeraana did a satisfactory business at box office |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=10 June 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100619204728/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=listcategory&cat=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-06-19 |accessdate=10 June 2010 |df= }}</ref> The film received mixed to positive reviews from critics; praising the writer and director for touching a condemnatory topic though criticing its "over-the-top melodrama".<ref name=veeraana/> Having a strong buzz prior its release, the film was proved to be a commercial success.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=96207 |title=Prior its release, seven shows of Veeraan booked housefull |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 May 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100516111848/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=listcategory&cat=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-05-16 |accessdate=13 May 2010 |df= }}</ref> The last release of year featured Manik in the drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010) which was directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and starring opposite Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Fathimath Fareela]].<ref name="Heyonuvaane">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is victimised of domestic abuse.<ref name="Heyonuvaane" /> Even though the film majorly received negative reviews from critics, it emerged as a Mega-Hit and second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name="HeyonuvaaneDVD">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="HeyonuvaaneReview">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |deadurl=yes |archivedate=26 September 2018 |accessdate=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he worked with Hamid Ali for his ''[[Laelaa]]'' (2011) starring [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Amira Ismail]], [[Ahmed Easa]] and Hamid Ali.<ref name="Laelaa">{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |title="Laela": Why is a good screenplay needed? |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111011190147/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-11 |accessdate=5 October 2018 |df= }}</ref> The film revolves around two daughters who were forced to arranged marriages by their parent.<ref name="Laelaa" /> The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics and was declared a flop at box office.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |title=Laela's premiere: A big satisfaction for Hamid |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002195434/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-02 |accessdate=11 October 2018 |df= }}</ref>
In 2015, Manik was seen in [[Ravee Farooq]]-directed film ''[[Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey]]'' (2015) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]] and [[Mohamed Manik]]. The film follows a mother who is ready to do anything in her power to protect her child from any harm of adversity from a man who becomes afflicted with "Post Traumatic Amnesia".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/en/24524 |title=Ticket sales kick-off for "Mikoe Bappa Bae Bae" |publisher=Vaguthu |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=9 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vnews.mv/48730 |title=Dhivehi movie ''Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey'' released |publisher=''vnews'' |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=13 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |title=Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey: Ravi-Mahdi showed difference again |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Saeed, Asiyath Mohamed |language=Divehi|date=13 August 2015 |accessdate=8 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150816010157/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |archivedate=16 August 2015 }}</ref> It was one of the three entries from Maldives to the SAARC Film Festival 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |title=Three entries to SAARC Film Festival; No award |language=Divehi|publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Ahmed, Jaishan |date=9 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160615140918/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |archivedate=15 June 2016 |accessdate=15 June 2016}}</ref>

{{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Manik, Koyya Hassan}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Mal√©]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actors]] [[Category:Maldivian film actors]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]]

'''Hassan Manik''' is a Maldivian film actor.
==Career== The Mohamed Hilmy and Ali Waheed directed film, ''[[Ihsaas]]'' was released in 1993 in which Manik starred as a guardian to an orphan boy who is being psychologically disturbed following a [[false arrest]]. Afterwards, he played the role of a dedicated brother who discovers the immoral relationship of his niece with one of her teachers, in [[Amjad Ibrahim]]'s debut direction ''[[Huras]]'' (1996).<ref>{{cite news|url=https://raajje.mv/news/3058 |title=Amjey is unlucky when it comes to awards |work=Raajje.mv |language=Divehi |last=Abdulla |first=Azlifa |date=7 January 2017 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/a0Sc2 |deadurl=no |archivedate=15 November 2018 |accessdate=15 November 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was developed solely with the intention of winning [[Gaumee Film Awards]] though it failed to garner any award at the 2nd Gaumee Film Awards ceremony.<ref name=Huras>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10626 |title=Amjey shocked with his deserving award |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=23 December 2016 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/C31be |deadurl=no |archivedate=22 December 2018 |accessdate=22 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In 2000, Manik featured alongside [[Ahmed Asim]], Mariyam Nazima and [[Waleedha Waleed]] in the Haajara Abdul Kareem-directed ''[[Ajaaib]]'' which marks the first film in which Manik plays the lead role. The film depicts the relationship of two exemplary wives and their respective families regardless of societal norms.<ref name=Ajaaib>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |title=Top 10 Actors in Maldives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=16 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219100014/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117146 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref> He then played a supporting role in a film directed by Ali Waheed, ''[[Kulunu]]'' starring Ismail Wajeeh and Aishath Shirani, in which Manik was featured as an advisor to a conflicted father who arranges the marriage of his only daughter to an already committed man. The same year, he starred opposite [[Hussain Sobah]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]] and [[Mariyam Nisha]] in [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s debut direction ''[[Fahuneyvaa]]'' (2000) which portrays the love-conflict of a man between a prominent stage performer and a deaf-mute poor girl.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=4426 is a masterpiece by Nahula |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=21 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330060956/https://avas.mv/24396 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In the film, he played the role of Zubair Ali, father of a second wife who discovers her husband's secret marriage.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24768 |title=Nahula at her peak; aiming for 50 shows |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=1 October 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/12p50 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was critically appreciated by critics and was a commercial success.<ref name=Fahuneyvaa>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Mohamed Shavin]] and Ibrahim Giyas in the [[Amjad Ibrahim]]-directed ''[[Aaah (film)|Aaah]]'' (2001) which revolves around two siblings involved in family business and the downfall of the younger brother's love life when he discovers his fiance is already married to an abusive husband.<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> This was followed by [[Fathimath Nahula]]'s drama film ''[[Naaummeedhu]]'' (2001) which depicts the story of a happily married couple whose life is shattered into pieces when they unintentionally invite a seductive woman into their life.<ref name=NahulaGaumeeInaam>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2009 - Fathimath Nahula |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/cai8A |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film received favourable reviews from critics and emerged as the highest grossing Maldivian film of the year.<ref name=Zuleykha>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/7801 |title=Nahula Vs Tedry: Who among the two brought a revelation to Maldivian Cinema? |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 September 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908184812/https://avas.mv/7801 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Manik collaborated with Easa Shareef for the horror film ''[[Ginihila]]'' (2003) alongside [[Ali Seezan]], [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Mariyam Nisha]] and [[Reeko Moosa Manik]], playing the role of Ibrahim Rafeeu, father of a mentally unstable young girl who commits suicide when her boyfriend rebuked her demand to leave his wife for her.<ref name=ginihila/><ref>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/24396 |title=Easa Shareef returns with a Lhen Foiy |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Ifraz |first=Ali |date=18 January 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181203125554/https://avas.mv/43170 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a young couple who decide to spend a romantic break to save their crumbling marriage and how events take a sinister turn when the wife experiences supernatural incidents involving her husband.<ref name=ginihila>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/entertainment/32682?ref=mhr-home |title=Wish these actors will return |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=15 March 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/zZ6kn |deadurl=no |archivedate=12 December 2018 |accessdate=12 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film is an unofficial remake of [[Vikram Bhatt]]'s [[Bollywood|Indian]] [[horror film]] ''[[Raaz (2002 film)|Raaz]]'' (2002) featuring [[Bipasha Basu]], [[Dino Morea]], [[Malini Sharma]] and [[Ashutosh Rana]] which itself is an unofficial adaptation of ''[[What Lies Beneath]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Bollywood plays the aping game|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|work=[[Times of India]]|accessdate=27 April 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050417232830/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/cms.dll/html/uncomp/articleshow?msid=63638|archivedate=17 April 2005}}</ref>
Manik received critical acclaim for his "authentic" performance as a pervert in [[Abdul Faththaah]]'s critically praised romantic film ''[[Vehey Vaarey Therein]]'' (2005).<ref name=VeheyVaarey>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=658lid=177&wid=186 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2003 - Yoosuf Shafeeu |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=https://archive.is/WtLwN |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Featuring [[Jamsheedha Ahmed]], [[Khadheeja Ibrahim Didi]], [[Mohamed Shavin]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Aminath Rasheedha]] in pivotal roles, the film narrates the story of unrequited love, and proved to be one of the highest-grossing Maldivian films of the year. [[Moomin Fuad]] and [[Ali Shifau]]'s critically appreciated crime film ''[[Heylaa (film)|Heylaa]]'' (2006) featured Manik in a small role as a concerned citizen.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/44005 |title=Fuad regrets his involvement in Happy Birthday |language=Divehi |work=Dho? |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 October 2018 |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/0U4IL |deadurl=no |archivedate=17 January 2019 |accessdate=17 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film narrates the story of a fourteen year old ambitious boy who finds himself unknowingly being involved in the smuggling of a revolver.<ref name=DRE11years/> It was the first Maldivian film to be shot in high-definition digital video.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=1343 |title=Gaumee Inaam 2018 - Ali Shifau |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archiveurl=http://archive.fo/8kp79 |deadurl=no |archivedate=3 December 2018 |accessdate=3 December 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Though the film received positive reviews from critics, it was a commercial failure.<ref name=DRE11years>{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/23701 |title=11 years anniversary for DRE; what did they achieve? |language=dv|work=Dho |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=14 September 2017 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/3d8z7 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=18 September 2018 |accessdate=18 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name=Moomin>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/107034 |title=Moomin not satisfied even after 12 Awards |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=4 July 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181216101531/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/DZ2eg |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Co-director of the film Shifau opined that its commercial status was a result of casting "not very prominent" faces in the film and the "film-goers were not ready to accept the genre" at the time of release.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.sun.mv/109020 |title=Chippe with new hopes after receiving National Award |language=Divehi |work=Sun |last=Luba |first=Aminath |date=8 August 2018 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/aLZ95 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=16 December 2018 |accessdate=16 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> His next release, [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]], [[Fathimath Fareela]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=Top10Actresses>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=5 March 2012 |accessdate=26 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2009, Manik starred alongside [[Niuma Mohamed]], [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Nadhiya Hassan]] as a supportive father-in-law of a secure first wife in Seezan's melodrama ''[[Karuna Vee Beyvafa]]'' (2009).<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa/> The film follows a downfall of a happily married couple on realizing the wife's infertility and destruction of their relationship with the invasion of a second wife.<ref name=KarunaVeeBeyvafaa>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |title=Politics is a challenge to entertainment industry |language=Divehi|publisher=Vaguthu |author=Hassan, Nazim |date=22 June 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160628083248/http://www.vaguthu.mv/reports/289441/ |archivedate=28 June 2016 |accessdate=28 June 2016}}</ref> Manik's first release of 2010 was the [[Ali Seezan]]-directed family drama ''[[Maafeh Neiy]],'' another collaboration with Seezan and [[Niuma Mohamed]].<ref name="MaafehNei">{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |title=Posters of Maafeh Nei is heavily criticised |language=dv |work=Haveeru |last=Naseer |first=Ismail |date=18 February 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100219063844/http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=93292&category=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=19 September 2018 |accessdate=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film highlights many social issues including [[human rights]] abuses, [[forced marriage]]s and [[domestic violence]].<ref name="MaafehNei" /> He played the role of Naseer, a wealthy businessman who abuses his wife.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> The film received mixed reviews from critics, but was a moderate success at box office.<ref name="MaafehNei" /> Later in 2010, Manik appeared in a small role in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s ''[[Veeraana]]'' which deals with [[child sexual abuse]].<ref name=veeraana>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=97210 |title=Veeraana did a satisfactory business at box office |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=10 June 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100619204728/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=listcategory&cat=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-06-19 |accessdate=10 June 2010 |df= }}</ref> The film received mixed to positive reviews from critics; praising the writer and director for touching a condemnatory topic though criticing its "over-the-top melodrama".<ref name=veeraana/> Having a strong buzz prior its release, the film proved to be a commercial success.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/?page=details&id=96207 |title=Prior its release, seven shows of Veeraan booked housefull |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=13 May 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100516111848/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/?page=listcategory&cat=ihUfinum |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2010-05-16 |accessdate=13 May 2010 |df= }}</ref> The last release of the year featured Manik in the drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010) which was directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and starring opposite Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Fathimath Fareela]].<ref name="Heyonuvaane">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is a victim of domestic abuse.<ref name="Heyonuvaane" /> Even though the film mainly received negative reviews from critics, it emerged as the second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name="HeyonuvaaneDVD">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |deadurl=yes |archivedate=28 September 2018 |accessdate=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="HeyonuvaaneReview">{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |deadurl=yes |archivedate=26 September 2018 |accessdate=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The following year, he worked with Hamid Ali for his ''[[Laelaa]]'' (2011) starring [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Amira Ismail]], [[Ahmed Easa]] and Hamid Ali.<ref name="Laelaa">{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |title="Laela": Why is a good screenplay needed? |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=6 October 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111011190147/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/maldives_film_industry/111087 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-11 |accessdate=5 October 2018 |df= }}</ref> The film revolves around two daughters who were forced into arranged marriages by their parent.<ref name="Laelaa" /> The film and his performance received negative reviews from critics and was declared a flop at the box office.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |title=Laela's premiere: A big satisfaction for Hamid |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002195434/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/110747 |deadurl=yes |archivedate=2011-10-02 |accessdate=11 October 2018 |df= }}</ref>
In 2015, Manik was seen in the [[Ravee Farooq]]-directed film ''[[Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey]]'' (2015) opposite [[Aishath Rishmy]] and [[Mohamed Manik]]. The film follows a mother who is ready to do anything in her power to protect her child from any harm of adversity from a man who becomes afflicted with "Post Traumatic Amnesia".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/en/24524 |title=Ticket sales kick-off for "Mikoe Bappa Bae Bae" |publisher=Vaguthu |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=9 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vnews.mv/48730 |title=Dhivehi movie ''Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey'' released |publisher=''vnews'' |author=Reehan, Mohamed | date=13 August 2015 | accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |title=Mikoe Bappa Baey Baey: Ravi-Mahdi showed difference again |publisher=''Haveeru Daily'' |author=Saeed, Asiyath Mohamed |language=Divehi|date=13 August 2015 |accessdate=8 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150816010157/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/175743 |archivedate=16 August 2015 }}</ref> It was one of the three entries from the Maldives to the SAARC Film Festival 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |title=Three entries to SAARC Film Festival; No award |language=Divehi|publisher=''Vaguthu'' |author=Ahmed, Jaishan |date=9 June 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160615140918/http://www.vaguthu.mv/evaguthu/423846/ |archivedate=15 June 2016 |accessdate=15 June 2016}}</ref>
